SEARCH
Package tetris.boards

Class BoardWithPhysics

java.lang.Object
tetris.boards.Board
tetris.boards.BoardWithPhysics
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModernTetrisBoardWithPhysics, NESBoardWithPhysics
public abstract class BoardWithPhysics extends Board
A concrete implementation of Board that includes a full physics engine.

This class is designed for boards that are simulated locally, meaning all movement, gravity, rotation, and collision checks are calculated on this client. This is used for Single Player games and for the "Local Player" board in Multiplayer games.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardWithPhysics

      public BoardWithPhysics(int x, int y, int gridRows, int gridSpawnRows, int gridColumns, int tetrominoesQueueSize, TetrominoesGeneratorType tetrominoesQueueGeneratorType, long seed, RotationSystemType rotationSystemType, double initialGravity, int lockDelayFrames)
      Constructs a board with active physics.
      Parameters:
      x - X screen coordinate.
      y - Y screen coordinate.
      gridRows - Visible rows.
      gridSpawnRows - Hidden spawn rows.
      gridColumns - Columns.
      tetrominoesQueueSize - Next queue size.
      tetrominoesQueueGeneratorType - RNG algorithm.
      seed - Random seed.
      rotationSystemType - The ruleset for rotation (e.g., Super Rotation System).
      initialGravity - Cells per frame the piece falls.
      lockDelayFrames - Frames a piece waits on the ground before locking.

  • Method Details

    • isFallingTetrominoLocked

      protected boolean isFallingTetrominoLocked()
      Delegates the lock check to the Gravity component.
      Specified by:
      isFallingTetrominoLocked in class Board
      Returns:
      true if the piece should lock, false otherwise.

    • updateFallingTetromino

      protected void updateFallingTetromino()
      Updates physics components in the specific order required for responsive gameplay.
      1. Input: Player moves/rotates the piece first.
      2. Gravity: The piece falls. This ensures soft-drops/hard-drops from input are processed in the same frame.
      Specified by:
      updateFallingTetromino in class Board

    • setNextTetrominoAsFallingTetromino

      protected void setNextTetrominoAsFallingTetromino()
      When a new piece spawns, it must be registered with the physics components so they know what to move.
      Overrides:
      setNextTetrominoAsFallingTetromino in class Board
